meanings.definition: The action of distorting or the state of being distorted.
meanings.sent1: The funhouse mirrors created funny distortions of our faces.
meanings.sent2: The artist used distortions in his painting to create a sense of movement.
meanings.sent3: The carnival mirror created amusing distortions of people's bodies.
meanings.sent4: The distortion of reality in the movie made it hard to distinguish between truth and fiction.
meanings.sent5: The heat caused a shimmering distortion on the horizon, making it look like a mirage.

meanings.definition: A change in the shape, size, or position of something.
meanings.sent1: The distortions in the metal were caused by extreme heat.
meanings.sent2: The map had distortions due to the way it was folded.
meanings.sent3: The distortions in the photo made everyone's heads look bigger.
meanings.sent4: The distortion of the image on the screen made it hard to see the details clearly.
meanings.sent5: The distortions in the glass made the view outside appear wavy.
